qas.question: What are copper compounds in liquid form used for?
What does copper wires along with zinc on roofs help to prevent?
What function does copper serve when used in textile fibers?
How is copper used with nickel?
What is used to treat structures for dry rot?
What are copper compounds in dragon form used for?
What does copper wires along with mud on roofs help to prevent?
What function does copper eliminate when used in textile fibers?
How is copper used with vodka?
What is used to implode structures for dry rot?

context: <a4_0><b9_0>Copper compounds<b9_0/><a4_0/> in liquid form are used as a <a0_0><b5_0>wood preservative<b5_0/><a0_0/>, particularly in treating original portion of structures during restoration of damage due to dry rot. Together with zinc, copper wires may be placed over non-conductive roofing materials to discourage the growth of <a1_0><b6_0>moss<b6_0/><a1_0/>.[citation needed] Textile fibers use copper to create <a2_0><b7_0>antimicrobial protective fabrics<b7_0/><a2_0/>, as do ceramic glazes, stained glass and musical instruments. Electroplating commonly uses copper <a3_0><b8_0>as a base<b8_0/><a3_0/> for other metals such as nickel.
